definition: to concede/to give in/to yield/a concession/(linguistics) concessive
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: We are now in no way to make any further concession in price.
sentences.chinese: 我们应经无法再在价格方面做出让步了。

sentences.english: He had to hit the bullet and give into his boss's unreasonable demands.
sentences.chinese: 是他勉为其难，让步接受了老板的苛刻要求。

sentences.english: Or maybe it is because trees, in the scheme of development, provide an easy compromise.
sentences.chinese: 又或许是在发展的进程表中，树让人更容易让步。

sentences.english: Looking back on it, I wish we hadn t been given in so easily.
sentences.chinese: 回过头来看，我希望我们没有这样轻易让步。

sentences.english: He wanted to stare me down on the price.
sentences.chinese: 他想让我在价格上做出让步。

sentences.english: Unprincipled concessions in diplomacy led to a crushing failure in real politics.
sentences.chinese: 外交上无原则的让步导致政治上一场毁灭性的失败。

sentences.english: In case there is a collision of characters Libra should concede.
sentences.chinese: 当出现性格上的碰撞时，天秤需要做出让步。

sentences.english: We must make some concession to the weakness of old age .
sentences.chinese: 我们要向老年虚弱者让步。

sentences.english: But he and others stressed that these concessions did not affect the overall targets.
sentences.chinese: 但是他和其他的议员强调这些让步并不影响整个大局。

sentences.english: Are the concessions by both sides an even trade?
sentences.chinese: 这种双边的让步是一个相等的交易吗？

sentences.english: At last, the Americans threw ih the towel on the television programming and film issue.
sentences.chinese: 最后，美国在电视节目和电影问题上作出了让步。

sentences.english: He gave in only at the last moment because he had no alternative .
sentences.chinese: 他只是在最后一刻因为没有选择才作了让步。

sentences.english: After being confronted with our evidence, the other side had to back down.
sentences.chinese: 面对我们摆出来的证据，对方只得作出让步。

sentences.english: We may consider making some concession in our price.
sentences.chinese: 在价格上，我们可以考虑作一些让步。

sentences.english: The Chinese media have dubbed her "the stubborn nail" for her refusal to give up.
sentences.chinese: 中国媒体将她拒绝让步的行为戏称为“钉子户”。

definition: to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to compromise/to reach terms/a compromise
to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
to express goodwill/to be friendly
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to settle (a dispute out of court)/to reconcile/settlement/conciliation/to become reconciled
unyielding attitude
to negotiate/negotiation/talks/conference/CL:個|个[ge4]
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
to surrender/to succumb/to yield/(as a transitive verb) to defeat/to prevail over
to bare one shoulder/(fig.) to side with/to discriminate in favor of
to pressure
to exercise forbearance/patient and accommodating
peace talks
to put up with/to tolerate
divergent/difference (of opinion, position)/disagreement/bifurcation (math.)
